question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [Metadata race] At lines 123-132, two separate metadata downloads occur - can an attacker modify metadata between these calls to cause inconsistent state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Progress update race] At lines 97-99 and 114, last_update_time is checked and updated non-atomically - can race conditions cause progress updates to be skipped or duplicated? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [Credential exposure] At line 120, Client::new() likely uses ambient credentials - can these be extracted through memory dumps, logs, or error messages? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: download_raw_file()] [Bucket enumeration] Error handling at lines 174-185 may reveal bucket existence - can an attacker enumerate valid bucket names by triggering specific error patterns? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Write permission abuse] At lines 103-112, the checker has write permission to new_bucket_name - can an attacker exploit this to overwrite or delete transaction files, not just progress files? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Struct: Processor] [Bucket name injection] At lines 29-31, bucket names are stored as strings without validation - can SQL injection, command injection, or SSRF payloads be injected through these names? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Content-Type confusion] At line 109, progress file is uploaded with 'application/json' content type - can an attacker exploit content-type mismatches to cause parsing errors or security bypasses? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Stale progress file] If progress file updates fail silently (network issues), can the checker continue incrementing versions without persisting state, causing massive verification gaps after restart? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Partial progress persistence] At line 94, version is incremented before progress file update - if update fails, can this cause the same file to be checked multiple times or skipped on restart? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [State initialization race] Between downloading progress file (lines 142-149) and validating chain_id (lines 151-156), can an attacker modify the progress file to pass validation with wrong version? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Version drift] If the checker is stopped and restarted frequently, can the 180-second progress update interval (line 23) cause significant version drift between actual progress and persisted state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Log injection] At lines 67-70, file_name and bucket_name are logged directly - can attackers inject malicious payloads into these fields to manipulate logs or obscure attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Information disclosure] At line 81, the full file_name is logged in error messages - can this reveal internal versioning schemes or storage patterns to attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Metric overflow] At line 82, FILE_DIFF_COUNTER is incremented without bounds - can repeated attacks cause metric counter overflow (IntCounter wrapping)? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [Sensitive data logging] At lines 157-160, starting_version is logged - if this reveals checkpoint information, can it be used to target specific transaction batches for attack? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Memory leak] At lines 58-60 and 77-78, downloaded files are held in memory until comparison - for large files, can repeated comparisons without proper cleanup cause memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Connection pool exhaustion] Multiple download_raw_file calls without apparent connection pooling - can rapid file checks exhaust cloud storage connection limits? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Sleep accumulation] At lines 73 and 85, sleep operations don't cancel on shutdown - can these accumulate and prevent graceful shutdown or cause delayed restarts? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Constant: PROGRESS_FILE_UPDATE_INTERVAL_IN_SECS] [Update frequency] At line 23, 180-second interval may be too long - can this cause significant data loss if the process crashes between updates? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [No cryptographic verification] At line 79, files are compared byte-by-byte without hash verification - can bit flips during download cause false positives even if cloud storage data is correct? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [Compression oracle] Since files use Lz4CompressedProto format (line 57), can an attacker exploit compression ratio differences to infer transaction content without downloading full files? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: run()] [No integrity attestation] The checker verifies equality but doesn't verify that files contain valid transaction data - can both buckets contain identical but malformed data that passes checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: download_raw_file()] [Man-in-the-middle] Downloads at line 171 don't appear to verify TLS certificates or signatures - can a MITM attacker intercept and modify files during download? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Struct: Processor] [No validation] Fields at lines 28-33 have no validation in constructor - can invalid configurations (empty strings, u64::MAX versions) cause undefined behavior? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-checker/src/processor.rs] [Function: init()] [Metadata dependency] At lines 123-132, the system is completely dependent on metadata files - if these are deleted or corrupted, can the checker ever recover without manual intervention? (High)
